intro: Anemopaegma chamberlaynii var. brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stemmed anemopaegma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is characterized by its compact growth habit and reduced flower size compared to the typical species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and endangered species.
